gameplay.ai.feeling

Class Feeling

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameplay.ai.feeling.Feeling
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Anger, Curiosity, Depression, PowerComplex

    public abstract class Feeling
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class representing an AI feeling

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int betrayalThreshold
      If the betrayal count goes above the betrayal threshold, then the robot must change its current feeling (randomness required)
      protected int feelingsBetrayalCount
      Number of betrayals (requests from the AI not done by the user) done by the user when the AI was currently in this feeling state
      protected int feelingsSlaveryCount
      Number of requests from the AI done positively by the user when the AI was in this feeling state
      protected java.util.HashSet<ProbabilityFeeling> nextFeelings
      Associative array containing the possible feelings if the number of betrayals (when the AI was in this feeling state) is greater than its threshold with the probability associated
      protected java.util.HashSet<ProbabilityFeeling> previousFeelings
      Associative array containing the possible feelings if the number of done actions asked by the AI is greater than its threshold with the probability associated
      protected int slaveryThreshold
      If the slavery count goes above the betrayal threshold, then the robot must change its current feeling (randomness required)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Feeling(int betrayalThreshold, int slaveryThreshold)
      Feeling constructor

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getBetrayalThreshold()
      Getter for the betrayal threshold field
      int getFeelingsBetrayalCount()
      Getter for the betrayal count field
      int getFeelingsSlaveryThreshold()
      Getter for the slavery count field
      java.lang.Class<Feeling> getNextFeeling()
      When the betrayal threshold is exceeded, this function is called and return a new feeling given their probabilities
      java.lang.Class<Feeling> getPreviousFeeling()
      When the slavery threshold is exceeded, this function is called and return a new feeling given their probabilities
      int getSlaveryThreshold()
      Getter for the slavery threshold field
      int incrementBetrayalCount()
      Increment and return the betrayal count field
      int incrementSlaveryCount()
      Increment and return the slavery count field

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • nextFeelings

        protected java.util.HashSet<ProbabilityFeeling> nextFeelings
        Associative array containing the possible feelings if the number of betrayals (when the AI was in this feeling state) is greater than its threshold with the probability associated

      • previousFeelings

        protected java.util.HashSet<ProbabilityFeeling> previousFeelings
        Associative array containing the possible feelings if the number of done actions asked by the AI is greater than its threshold with the probability associated
